availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James White (Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer. Perry County, Kentucky, native. Son of Rachel White. Married to Drucilla Moore White in Breathitt County, Kentucky, on July 23, 1858. Father of Mahala White, Mary White, Rebecca White, and Anderson White. Resident of Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 42B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 333.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Perry County, Campbell Precinct, p. 550A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994029, Breathitt County Marriages.
"James White (1837-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 40707215, accessed June 1, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40707215.
